issue.title: Plan variables are not accessible to the Plan DSL seed task
issue.body: Is it possible to set variables in the Seed task Plan that can get accessed by `System.getenv("bamboo_some_var)"`? As far as I can tell, the only environment variables available to the Seed task are JVM system properties. Is this improvement possible or am I missing the right way to access those variables?

issue.title: Plan variables are not accessible to the Plan DSL seed task
issue.body: Is it possible to set variables in the Seed task Plan that can get accessed by `System.getenv("bamboo_some_var)"`? As far as I can tell, the only environment variables available to the Seed task are JVM system properties. Is this improvement possible or am I missing the right way to access those variables?

comment.body: That is exactly what I was looking for. I guess I'm one of _those_ persons. Thank you for the response and sorry for the trouble.

issue.title: Documentation for how to define common Stages and Jobs
issue.body:
Is this technically possible? I get classloader errors when I try to define a Job or Stage in common code, similar to how using a common Job is documented here: https://github.com/mibexsoftware/bamboo-plan-dsl-plugin/wiki/Real-world-DSL-scripts

Would be great if that page also showed how to define and use common Plans/Stages/Jobs.

comment.body:
Please excuse my late response. The referred documentation shows how to use jobs in a common library function. Have you tried to use the same functionality but just with stages/plans when you experienced the classloader errors?

A minimal DSL example would help me a lot to reproduce this.

Thanks,
Michael

issue.title: Plan variables are not accessible to the Plan DSL seed task
issue.body: Is it possible to set variables in the Seed task Plan that can get accessed by `System.getenv("bamboo_some_var)"`? As far as I can tell, the only environment variables available to the Seed task are JVM system properties. Is this improvement possible or am I missing the right way to access those variables?

comment.body:
Hi,

You can access Bamboo build variables within your DSL scripts (see https://github.com/mibexsoftware/bamboo-plan-dsl-plugin/wiki/Advanced-topics#accessing-bamboos-env-variables). Does that help you or are you looking for something else?

Best regards,
Michael

issue.title: Plan Configuration -> Other -> (Concurrent build and Force stop) not implemented
issue.body:
There should be a way in the DSL to define:

- Default number of concurrent builds
- Force stop hanging builds and clean up sub-processes

comment.body:
Hi,

I've created internal feature requests for these two settings for the upcoming feature release.

Thanks,
Michael

issue.title: Setting permissions in the DSL doesn't have any effect

comment.body: OK thanks. Yeah, leaving the user blank was the problem.

issue.title: Setting permissions in the DSL doesn't have any effect

comment.body:
@twotired Thanks a lot for your detailed test case. When I run this DSL with admin permissions (configured user in the seed task), then all settings (even in the plan permissions) are correctly set. 

But when I don't specify a user in the seed task, the plan permissions are not configured. When you configure an admin user in the seed task, does it work for you as well?

issue.title: Setting permissions in the DSL doesn't have any effect
Setting permissions in the DSL doesn't have any effect

comment.body: @twotired Thanks for your example. I've just tried it out and for me the plug-in correctly created a VIEW permission for logged-in users. The permissions for ADMIN/EDIT are correctly ignored because they are overridden by the following VIEW permissions. Does that make sense? What permissions were set in your testing for logged-in users?

issue.title: Setting permissions in the DSL doesn't have any effect

comment.body: @twotired Thanks for your feedback. I've just tried to reproduce this with your sample DSL, but in my test case the permissions are correctly set (used your Bamboo and plug-in version): Just to be sure, could you please double-check that you are looking at the plan permission settings and not the project or the project plan inheritance settings? Thanks!

Support "Final" Stage
issue.body:
There seems to be no way to configure a Stage to be final. It should be possible to define a final stage that runs, even after a failed task.

If a stage is set to "FINAL" in the UI, and then I look at the configure -> DSL tab, there is no mention of the final setting.

comment.body: You're right, support for final stages is not yet implemented. We will address this with the next release of the app. I'll reply back here once it is available. Thanks, Michael

issue.title: Support "Final" Stage
issue.body:
There seems to be no way to configure a Stage to be final. It should be possible to define a final stage that runs, even after a failed task.

If a stage is set to "FINAL" in the UI, and then I look at the configure -> DSL tab, there is no mention of the final setting.

issue.title: Monitor bitbucket project/repo - auto create build plans
issue.body:
Can this plugin monitor a Bitbucket Project, so whenever a new repo is checked in, it will auto create all build plans and deployment plans relative to that project?

We want to have Bamboo DSL job scan a Bitbucket Project for new repos, once a new repo is checked it we want DSL job to run to create that repos Bamboo Plans.

comment.body: @sbhakta99 Hi. Please excuse my late response. No, there was no new release of the app targeting this feature request. We still have this on our roadmap, but it is not something we can provide in the very near future. Thank you for your understanding.

issue.title: Monitor bitbucket project/repo - auto create build plans
issue.body:
Can this plugin monitor a Bitbucket Project, so whenever a new repo is checked in, it will auto create all build plans and deployment plans relative to that project?

We want to have Bamboo DSL job scan a Bitbucket Project for new repos, once a new repo is checked it we want DSL job to run to create that repos Bamboo Plans.

comment.body: Hello, was there ever and update or solution for this?
